instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.820-2353: What is 820-2353? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> has green light on mag but won't charge or turn on
threads.message:
Got a macbook a 1286 come in the other day.
it has a green light on mag but won't charge or turn on.

anyone got any advice as a good place to start ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> has green light on mag but won't charge or turn on
threads.message:
logic board number?
have you try unplug the battery, keyboard flex cable and other cables then plug the charger to see if get light?
genuine apple 85w charger?
any history?
can you list all the power rails?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> has green light on mag but won't charge or turn on
threads.message:
It gets no light when nothing is plugged in.
I get the 3.4v at resistors near the battery meter plug

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> has green light on mag but won't charge or turn on
threads.message:
"logic board number?"
Do you really need help???

"genuine apple 85w charger?
any history?"
Reply to the questions, our help is based on your posts...

"can you list all the power rails?"
<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> on the basic pins should be good enough to start: 2, 4, 19, 20, 12, 13, 9, 15, 1, 26, 17/18, 27/28..

MLB w80180487fyra

however I have a genuine 85w charger and it still stays green, when I press battery indicator it lights up 1 bar, with or without the charger.

history.
they said it stopped loading and went to a grey screen. They said it stopped turning on. They brought a new battery. Still wouldn't turn on.
it had been sitting for a year or so. Then brought to me.
I have to download the board for board view and schematics.
will let you know reading soon

threads.message:
Ol
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is there.
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> is not there and shorted
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> is not there and shorted.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> has green light on mag but won't charge or turn on
threads.message:
"[URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/isl6259ahrtz.html"]<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>[/URL] on the basic pins should be good enough to start: 2, 4, 19, 20, 12, 13, 9, 15, 1, 26, 17/18, 27/28.."

S0 voltages are the last in the power sequence; give them time...

Post <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> voltages (1, 4, 5).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> has green light on mag but won't charge or turn on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.415v

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
2, 16.14v flaculating to 16.44v
4, 3.411v
20, 5.04v
12, 3.414v
13, 3.414v
9, 030.8mv
15. 050.3mv
1, 14.95v
26, 16.06v
17, 254.2mv counting down.
18, 212.3mv counting down
27, 000.7mv
28, 000.7mv

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> has green light on mag but won't charge or turn on
threads.message:
Resistance to ground at L7030?
Post <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86 resistance values; on boatd, no need to remove, 2M scale.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> has green light on mag but won't charge or turn on
threads.message:
L7030 in m ohms.  0.872 but seems to keep dropping.
I'm wandering jf mu multimeter is reading wrong, possibly broken in resistance mode.
The reading changes if I change polarity. And reading counts up or down and seems to not stop.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> has green light on mag but won't charge or turn on
threads.message:
Measuring <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86 in 2M scale, will give us an idea about leakage on <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>.
Just to measure 4 resistors, I can cannot explain more simple, sorry...

L7030, as other power rails, is sufficient to test on diode mode.
